alert.note: Alert for Clayton; Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:06AM EST until January 11 at 2:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Lovejoy affecting Clayton, Fayette and Spalding Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Americus, Peachtree City, Lovejoy, Fayetteville, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin, Thomaston, Molena, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Lovejoy. * WHEN...From early this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Significant flooding occurs of residential yards upstream of the gage between Upper Riverdale Road and Georgia Highway 138. Some roads begin to flood such as Upper Riverdale Road and Mockingbird Road. Flooding expands on portions of the Rivers Edge Golf Course. Several holes and fairways will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EST Wednesday was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 2.3 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.3 feet on 09/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 515 PM EST.
